meta.article_title: July 18, 2022 - Contact Point on Racket When Serving

terminologie_extrait.definition: The point on the racket where the wrist or elbow is located during the serve.
terminologie_extrait.contexte: Used to describe the location of the racket's rotation during the serve.

debutant.description: For maximum spin, contact the ball toward the tip. That's the fastest moving part of the racket as you put your wrist into the serve.

debutant.nom: Base of the paddle, near the handle
debutant.description: This allows you to use the same big spin serve motion and get little or no spin.

intermediaire.nom: Rotate the racket so that the axis of rotation is toward the middle of the racket
intermediaire.description: This means you get opposite spins depending on which side of the racket you contact the ball on.

exercices_complementaires.description: Serve so that, at contact, the tip is moving down (giving a backspin), but the area near the handle is moving up (giving a topspin or sidespin).

metriques_progression.description: Varying spin depending on the location of contact.
